intro: Megalastrum oppositum, commonly known as the oppositeleaf starflower, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite arrangement of leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
